title: Transfer the Lease of Bifrost Parachain 3356 to Bifrost Parachain 2030 to avoid downtime

Key stakeholders or beneficiaries: Bifrost parachain users and broader Polkadot ecosystem.
Governance parameters: Lease Admin Track with 10 concurrent capacity, 3hr confirm period, 2hr prepare, 28-day decision period, 10min enactment, and 5000 DOT decision deposit.
Proposer: 133VgJJgp1s9wxLqgCFxYx6T873hZQNchJM9tmbU6NkYaaqW.
Lease details: Transfer 8 lease periods (16-23) from 3356 to 2030.

Parachain teams.

title: Vote Nay. Is a toturial about How to Request Stable asset USDT, USDC
Summary:
Main objective/purpose: Vote nay on a tutorial about requesting stable assets (USDT, USDC).
Funding amounts and beneficiaries: 15 USDT to beneficiary 5HQKXmVVrSiTyWXiKaahxdTFqenYrAA5xCDuyjDrrjzvNpGE.
Technical changes or implementations: None explicitly stated.
Ecosystem impact: Promotes education on stable asset usage within the ecosystem.
Key stakeholders or beneficiaries: 5HQKXmVVrSiTyWXiKaahxdTFqenYrAA5xCDuyjDrrjzvNpGE.

title: AssetX the new Polkadot Asset Hub DEX
Summary:
Main Objective: Create a user-friendly DEX on Polkadot's Asset Hub to enhance DeFi accessibility and user experience.
Funding Amount: 524,000 USD (~73,327.61 DOT) requested from the OpenGov Treasury.
Beneficiary: 5FnBCSqPgeW7WLx53CN2pngM4MDsuqRUCEwdfXJeXkToSVQr (73.32K DOT).
Technical Changes: DEX with token swapping, liquidity pooling, and yield farming on Polkadot's Asset Hub.
Ecosystem Impact: Enhances DeFi accessibility, improves user experience, and increases Polkadot's TVL.
Key Stakeholders: Development team (AssetX Labs), auditors (OpenZeppelin, CertiK), and Polkadot community.

title: Cancelling treasury proposal #774
Summary:
Main objective/purpose: Cancel treasury proposal #774 due to community feedback and unintended negative impact.
Funding amounts and beneficiaries: No funding requested or distributed; proposal withdrawal.
Technical changes or implementations: None; proposal cancellation only.
Ecosystem impact: Proposal withdrawn to reassess project goals and community engagement strategy.
Key stakeholders or beneficiaries: Proposer (16CkbzjYiDyDouGZn1y5diYLueqqNQHScFEA7XkK4Mmcj2Mx).

title: Revolutionizing Social Media for a Better Internet
Summary:
Main Objective: Host a side event at Polkadot Decoded to showcase Frequency and MeWe integration for enhanced privacy and user empowerment in social media.
Funding: 116,000 EUR requested; 23,000 DOT allocated to beneficiary address 5EfKvhdeP9qxuJgXMooXRXnSx9VMhsBRCaHVDdHnKVTfk1WS.
Technical Changes: Integration of MeWe with Frequency's Layer-1 parachain on Polkadot for Web3 functionalities.
Ecosystem Impact: Showcases Polkadot's capabilities in supporting decentralized social media, attracting developers and projects.
Key Stakeholders: Frequency Network Foundation, MeWe, Polkadot community, and Web3 enthusiasts.
Status: Proposal withdrawn following community feedback.

title: Polkadot.js UI Bug When Initiating A Parathread for Parachain Auction
Summary:
Main objective: Address Polkadot.js UI bug causing incorrect reserve amount during parathread initiation for parachain auction.
Funding amount: 408.45 DOT
Beneficiary: 5D1yi9uvjWQ1EREqU4Rs5Ag6kgP1KDoJHjHzg8kPztEBgXkZ
Technical change: Fix UI bug in Polkadot.js related to parathread initiation.
Ecosystem impact: Prevents incorrect reserve amount issues, ensuring accurate parachain auction transactions.
Key stakeholders: Parachain teams and users initiating parathreads.

title: PLEASE VOTE NAY

title: StorageHub‚Äôs Codebase Audit
Summary:
Main objective: Audit of StorageHub's decentralized storage codebase to ensure security and reliability.
Funding amount: 385,978,000 aUSDT (385.98K USDT).
Beneficiary: 5Ge6Fo7MouBpFpUY5TFZWLSFbaAm9u2c3GXi464NEDhue8Sd (Moonsong Labs).
Technical changes: No direct code changes; audit by SRLabs to review and enhance codebase security.
Ecosystem impact: Enhances Polkadot's infrastructure security and supports ecosystem growth through reliable storage solutions.
Key stakeholders: Moonsong Labs (proposer/developer), SRLabs (auditor), Web3 Foundation (initial grant provider).

title: Referendum 631 top up due to DOT price change
Summary:
Main objective: Top-up funding due to DOT price fluctuation impacting initial grant.
Funding: Initial request $154,080 (16,348 DOT), received $109,368 (12.05.24), new request $44,712 USDT.
Technical changes: Request for 44,712,000,000 Planck (USDT) on parachain 1000.
Ecosystem impact: Adjustment to compensate for reduced funding due to price change.
Key stakeholders: Proposer (12sNU8BXivMj1xQmcd4T39ugCyHjmhir8jkPqfAw5ZDESrx4), beneficiary (5Dw5KnvTs96FaRQFez1Su15XMMJ65QAi4F1ugNBaXUBiGbX6).

title: Funding the Technical Fellowship Sub-Treasury
Summary:
Main objective: Fund the Technical Fellowship Sub-Treasury to enable direct funding of technical proposals.
Funding: 2 million DOT transferred from main Treasury to Core Fellowship sub-treasury.
Technical changes: Allows Fellowship to directly approve funding proposals; future integration with RFC-89 for automated inflation distribution.
Ecosystem impact: Enhances autonomy for Fellowship, streamlines technical project funding.
Key stakeholders: Core Fellowship, technical project teams.

title: VIRTUNE AB X POLKADOT - ETP CAMPAIGN, SWEDEN & THE NORDICS
Summary:
Main objective/purpose: Promote a 1:1 spot-backed, staked Polkadot ETP in Sweden and the Nordics to expand investor adoption.
Funding amounts and beneficiaries: Requesting 89,945 DOT ($571,150) for campaign costs, with 20% of IRL costs covered by Virtune AB.
Technical changes or implementations: Launch of a regulated, Nasdaq-listed Polkadot ETP with staking rewards.
Ecosystem impact: Targets 2,830 new investors, $4.4M ROI, and increased institutional adoption in the Nordics.
Key stakeholders or beneficiaries: Virtune AB, CultureDot, and the Polkadot community.

title: Inclusion of DED in marketing narratives
Summary:

title: Retroactive Sponsorship Reimbursement for Polkadot CCTF Yacht event at Token 2049, Dubai
Summary:

Funding amounts and beneficiaries: 4.18K DOT to beneficiary address 5D73ky4NEJ26k4KvfaP3x39VLVcGidbsdyxyfUkN8K99Hw8z.

2-3 week Identity downtime on Relay Chain.
UIs and wallets must adapt to changes.
Eventual 100x deposit reduction on People Chain.

Wallets and UI providers needing to implement changes.

title: Polkadot's Economics Parameters: Proposal 1 (10% constant total inflation)
Summary:
Main objective/purpose: Adjust Polkadot's economic parameters to implement a 10% constant total inflation.
Funding amounts and beneficiaries: 15% of total inflation allocated to the treasury.
Technical changes or implementations:

Fixed treasury inflow of 15% of total inflation.
Removed staking reward adjustments based on staking rate discrepancy.
Parameters: MaxStakerReward: 85%, max_inflation: 10%, min_inflation: 8.5%.


Ecosystem impact: Predictable inflation model, reduced complexity, and increased treasury funding for ecosystem development.
Key stakeholders or beneficiaries: Polkadot Treasury, stakers, and the broader Polkadot ecosystem.

title: Polkadot's Economics Parameters: Proposal 2 (8% constant total inflation)
Summary:
Main objective: Adjust Polkadot's economic parameters to implement a constant total inflation rate of 8% on current total issuance.
Funding: 15% of inflation allocated to the Treasury.
Technical changes:

MaxStakerReward: 85%
max_inflation: 8%
min_inflation: 6.8%


Ecosystem impact: Affects token issuance, staking rewards, and Treasury funding.
Key stakeholders: Polkadot Treasury and DOT token holders.

title: Polkadot's Economics Parameters: Proposal 3 (8% total inflation in the first year, then gradually decreasing)
Summary:
Main objective/purpose: Adjust Polkadot's economic parameters to set an 8% total inflation rate in the first year, which will gradually decrease over time, with a fixed 15% allocation to the Treasury.
Funding amounts and beneficiaries: 15% of total inflation allocated to the Treasury; remaining 85% for stakers and other uses.
Technical changes or implementations:

MaxStakerReward set to 85%.
max_inflation starts at 8% and decreases over time.
min_inflation equal to staker inflation.


Ecosystem impact: Reduces overall inflation over time, stabilizes token issuance, and ensures consistent Treasury funding.
Key stakeholders or beneficiaries: DOT holders, stakers, and the Polkadot Treasury.

title: Inflation decreasing - Gavin Wood vision
Summary:
Main objective: Implement inflation reduction model with a maximum supply cap based on Euler's number (2.71828) instead of Pi (3.14159).
Funding: No direct funding or beneficiaries specified.
Technical changes: Introduce a maximum supply cap, adjusting inflation to 10% of the difference between max supply and current supply annually.
Ecosystem impact: Reduces long-term inflation, provides predictable economic path, and attracts investors by capping supply growth.
Key stakeholders: Polkadot community, long-term DOT holders, and potential investors.

title: [ Wish for change ] Unifying Polkadot Ecosystem Address Format

Technical changes: Adopt SS58 prefix:0 (addresses starting with '1') for all compatible chains.
Technical changes: Implement readable address prefixes based on EIP-3770 standard.
Ecosystem impact: Reduces user confusion, minimizes asset transfer errors, and streamlines development.
Key stakeholders: Wallet providers, dApps, exchanges, and developers.

title: Introduce quadratic funding to the polkadot treasury spending

Bounty creation for funding pool.
Funding rounds with predetermined budgets and topics.
Curator-reviewed project applications.
Quadratic funding calculations and child bounties for distribution.


Ecosystem impact:

Reduces dominance of whales in treasury decisions.
Encourages broader community participation.
Provides alternative to OpenGov treasury spending.


Key stakeholders or beneficiaries:

Entire Polkadot community, particularly smaller contributors.
Projects seeking funding through a more equitable process.
Curators and reviewers of funding rounds.

Summary:

Addresses service providers' needs for physical addresses and fiat payments.
PCF handles contract management, KYB procedures, and fiat conversions.
Dedicated "legal fund" covers compliance, contract creation, and administrative costs.
Standardized contracts developed for efficiency, with custom options available.
PCF instructed to create an account on Polkadot Hub, controlled by PCF, funded by MB.
MB to report quarterly on activities with PCF for transparency.
Scope limited to Polkadot marketing initiatives.
Contracts must comply with Cayman Islands law and Polkadot governance.
Aligns with marketing objectives set by Ref 1166 and future amendments.

title: Emergency Response Plan for Securing 200,000 DOT

paras.force_set_current_code and paras.force_set_current_head to disable parachain functionality.
registrar.remove_lock to regain parachain control.
utility.dispatch_as to remove attacker proxies.
utility.batch_all for unstaking and transferring funds.
staking.rebond as a fallback strategy.


Ecosystem impact: Protects user funds, prevents further attacks, and maintains network security.
Key stakeholders or beneficiaries: Affected account holders, Polkadot parachain users, and the broader Polkadot ecosystem.

title: Polkadot Storage Phase 3

Lightweight proof system using Merkle proofs and zk-SNARKs.

Slashing and economic model improvements for storage providers.


Ecosystem impact:

Establishes Polkadot as a competitive decentralized storage solution.
Supports parachain growth by enabling storage for diverse applications.


Key stakeholders: Polkadot ecosystem, parachain developers, and decentralized storage users.
